website_summaries.verdict: Quick to assemble, sturdy yet lightweight, and easy to store, this drying rack offers a good value for its price.
pros: Thanks to its foldable design, it's portable and can easily be stowed out of sight
Consumers appreciate the low-profile design that works for virtually any space, and that it offers plenty of room for drying multiple items
cons: A few felt this model wasn't the best in terms of longevity, and some reported it didn't stand up well when used with heavier items such as towels

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Indoor Drying of Cloth Diapers
customer_reviews.text: Just received today and even better than I expected. This was purchased to use for drying cloth diapers and other baby items. It holds at least 28 cloth diapers and 23 inserts (shown in photo) with room to spare. This came assembled and all I had to do was take it out of the box and plastic, unfold, and voilà! The best part is that it's compact enough to fit in our laundry room/pantry at our apartment or can be folded and put away or taken with us.
customer_reviews.author: kcotton4166

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made. Buy another brand.
customer_reviews.text: This was not as advertised. I expected sturdy and got something so stiff could barely unbend initially. When I went to connect the ends, they are uneven so the left and right edges don’t meet (see photos). Unfortunately, this is another disappointing Amazon vendor to cross off my list. Now I have to waste time returning and making my way to a big-box store. This definitely takes away from the conveniences of online shopping! Hopefully, my review is saving someone else the trouble here. You’ve been warned!
customer_reviews.author: MzKiesha

customer_reviews.title: Really Bad Quality Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cheap quality product! It broke with the weight of bath towels only within a matter of 3 months!
customer_reviews.author: MSA

customer_reviews.title: THIS THING FALLS APART!
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but this product was terrible. I had my last drying rack for about 15 years. It was wood and solid. We gave it to one of our kids, so needed a new one. It is just my husband and me and we are very careful and hang delicates on it once a week. The bars started coming apart. No matter what I did, I could not get them all to go in. I put one in, another fell out. Many of the screws came loose. My husband is an engineer, looked at it, and said it is a piece of junk and order a new one! I am baffled by the good reviews!
customer_reviews.author: paul b.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these and the only good thing I can say about it is that it arrived promptly. When I opened the box two of the rungs were way went. one I was able to straighten out, the other broke when I tried to straighten it. I don't know if this happened in shipping. It was a good box that showed no damage or it happened in packing, either way I am out of a drying rack. It is a flimsy thing that would not hold towels, much less jeans. Piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Haywood

customer_reviews.title: and could benefit from having something like this to hang clothes to dry
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for us to hang our delicates up to dry. Everybody has certain items that cannot go through the dryer (Lululemon items, other delicates, etc.), and could benefit from having something like this to hang clothes to dry. This rack holds multiple pairs of pants, or many clothes on hangers. It is the perfect way to organize laundry, and keep clothes clean while they dry. I highly recommend this product as it is sturdy, sufficient, and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Bean & PeanutTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Won't last 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I decided to replace a 15+ year old wooden rack because my son accidentally broke a rod horsing around in the basement. The stupidest thing I did was to throw it away after I purchased this as a replacement. First, almost immediately the top rod came loose. Then within days three other rods have come loose and the entire thing barely can stand up. I was never able to hang heavy items like jeans or sweaters on it. The old rack used to hold half a load of wet clothes without issue. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: FrequentFlyer

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart After One Year
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for 12 months and for a while, it felt like a decent, adequate drying rack. Unfortunately, after one year of gentle use, the pegs have started to come loose and the plastic bits holding the screws in have become warped. The rack no longer stays together. The build is very cheap. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy
customer_reviews.text: I used this to hang my baby's clothes and it is perfect. No issues so far, it is quick to assemble, very lightweight and can be stored easily. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-an

customer_reviews.title: Prefer wood over metal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a wooden one I already had. The wooden one was purchased 15 years ago and it is still holding up fine. I am not thrilled with this metal one. Once you set it up, it is hard to move. The top slides undone very easily. I have had two of the metals rods come off the one side already when I was moving it. They do snap back in. With wood and nails, I have never had to worry about it coming apart when I move it. If I purchase another one, it won't be metal.
customer_reviews.author: Tartar05

customer_reviews.title: Good drying rack, but careful with heavy items
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drying rack for a little over three years. It works very well for drying and seems to hold up as long as it isn't covered with heavy clothing/cloth materials. Every winter I use it to dry my sweaters (about 8 wet, heavyweight sweaters almost every week) and every winter I noticed it bent a little more. This year it bent to point where it now falls over every time I have something other than socks and undergarments on it. I would recommend it for most items, but it would last a lot longer if there were only lightweight items hanging on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Size
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this folding dryer rack. I wasn't sure I wanted to pay quite that much, but I've gotten cheaper ones in the past, and I wanted one that might be better quality and last longer. This one feels like it will be very durable. It's made of better quality materials than others I've had. It's a little stiff right now, but setting it up isn't a problem. It was easy to assemble, too. The part that snaps over a bar to hold it together is very sturdy and will definitely hold together a long time. It has as much room as the larger wooden dryer rack I'm replacing. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Judy B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: VERY pleasantly surprised at the weight and build of this drying rack. Way better than my old wooden one. The notch where the top bar fits is very secure. So far, I haven't had any issues with the rack collapsing while putting on the clothes to dry. Fits nicely in my bathtub and easy to put up and take down. Takes a small footprint in the closet where I store it. Great rack for the amount of money I paid for it!
customer_reviews.author: Maria in Tampa

customer_reviews.title: Fallen apart already though I use it very little!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item a couple of months ago. I use it maybe once a week for the past 7-8 months. It's been very unreliable and all the racks have come apart. It's literally fallen apart and and I have to reassemble it every time I use it. And then upon folding it comes apart again. I would not recommend users buying this rack as it was not long lasting at all!
customer_reviews.author: Shakeel Hussain

customer_reviews.title: Another defective / poor quality Amazon Basics item, and awful customer service
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive (dried) was oozing out at all the connective parts; end caps were bent and partly coming off the ends (a safety hazard); coated paint was bubbling; was awkward to fold. Customer service was unprofessional - Amazon has created its own brand of apparently rather poor quality items, ships out these poor quality/defective items to customers, requires the customer to deal with the hassle to return the item. When customer calls amazon to express concern over the ongoing quality problems and safety issues of their products, Amazon customer service does not deal with the problem or offer adequate customer satisfaction. Will not be purchasing Amazon Basics items in the future.
customer_reviews.author: bk

customer_reviews.title: Multi uses for this clothes drying rack!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sturdy white rack a few weeks ago. Mainly I got it because so many clothes labels suggest air drying, as opposed to the dryer which can shrink or damage delicate fabrics. So I hang sweaters, and lingerie, and it fits nicely in the tub, behind the shower curtain,and out of sight. But I recently did a local antique show, and realized it was perfect for displaying a handmade quilt, and several other small items which would have gone unnoticed if they were just folded on the table. light and very compact folded, and a very good value with fast shipping. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Golas

customer_reviews.title: Great laundry rack for drying clothes!
customer_reviews.text: I like to wear lots of jerseys and have other family members who wear delicate clothes which shouldn't be put through the dryer, so this is very useful. Some other reviewers commented about how this isn't strong enough, but use some common sense (like not putting a huge, wet towel on it) and it won't break. Obviously it's not a heavy duty rack and meant more for clothes, small bath mats or towels, but it works great and folds up very easily. Storage is compact and I have been using it for a few weeks and works great. It's very sturdy and looks nice too. I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: VY

customer_reviews.title: perfect for drying in the sun
customer_reviews.text: I like my towels to be dried in the sun so I purchased this drying rack, it opens and closes easily, it stores flat in a small space and it took the weight of my heavy bath towels along with face clothes, hand towels, kitchen towels and dog towels. I also used it to dry shirts, shorts and underwear. It's perfect and I would recommend this product..oh yes, one other thing, it's tall enough for my towels!
customer_reviews.author: Pearl's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy and light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the bamboo one I’ve had for around 15 years. The bamboo finally cracked. I was looking for a plastic one so I don’t have to worry about rust but settled for this. It’s metal but it seems like it’ll last long without rusting. Only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect when my dryer died and...
customer_reviews.text: I wound up waiting a month for a new dryer and this saved me lots of frustration and money (going to a laundromat). It holds more than I expected, is lightweight and easy to fold and put away. I ordered this one because the bars are covered - not bare metal as some others were (no snags, etc) Very happy I found it and anticipate it will last for many years. I plan to use it all the time for my smaller items/fast to dry items - instead of using my dryer. Retired folks on small incomes look for many ways to save on routine expenses! This does it for me!
customer_reviews.author: DonnaC

customer_reviews.title: Handy clothes dryer
customer_reviews.text: This is a very convenient clothes dryer for hand washed items you can't dry in the clothes dryer. It folds up nicely to store out of the way. Since it is metal the bars wont's break or splinter. I really like that. The white paint helps place items on and off easily. I do wish it are sturdier but don;t know if that is possible with the structure as it is. It's just like the old fashioned wood dryers but better as the bars won't break.
customer_reviews.author: karenlockwood

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed but functional
customer_reviews.text: It is much shorter than I expected. The bars that run across the top and snap in to keep it propped up are not exactly straight. There is a lot less space between hanging bars than would facilitate good air flow. Seems rather flimsy but holds up after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding rack
customer_reviews.text: I really dig this drying rack, it does exactly what it says it does, it hangs your clothes untill they're dry, then it folds up real nice. You can store it in most places that it fits and I recommend folding it up before trying to slide it under your couch or you will probably poke holes in the couch and destroy the drying rack. It's also study wooooo boy is it sturdy! You can probably set like 10-13 dictionaries on this bad boy no problem. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: David Krok

customer_reviews.title: Too small and won’t fit many things on it!
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to fold and doesn’t take much space, however it won’t fit a lot of clothes. I honestly would’ve rather paying more for more space. From the top the racks are so close to each other you really can’t fit big stuff on these racks, you can’t really use the middle ones because there’s no space from inside. It’s probably good for a tiny studio and small pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam

customer_reviews.title: Very affordable rack and very nice color
customer_reviews.text: Amazon Basics has really good home goods for a cheap price that comes to you quickly. This was easy to set up right out of the box and holds a lot of clothing. To put it away it easily folds. I wouldn't put anything to heavy say like a down comforter on this but I did put about 10 t-shirts and it held up well and my clothes dried by the afternoon. I actually would be another rack just to have 1 more rack and I think it would be a great housewarming gift or for a college student who is just starting out. Buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Teinegurl

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for the past several months to sun dry my clothes. The thing is nice and solid and has a plastic coating and so no rust marks on clothes. Its not super stable ( a little bit wobbly when fully loaded) but pretty usable. The great thing is that this is light and easy to fold. My rating is : 5/5 Bravo Amazon !
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mandal

customer_reviews.title: Very solid, great value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old wooden rack with a nearly identical design. It’s so much sturdier, much nicer than I expected for the price. One time it was not sitting level on all four feet. I found that gently pressing down on the top with the feet on a solid surface compresses the accordion sides and makes the feet level.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be improved
customer_reviews.text: The price is great, it is has more than enough room to hang a small-medium load, and the quality of the materials is good. I gave it four stars because the locking mechanism is flimsy. If you pull up on the "roof" of the structure, the whole rack could collapse. It would be much more secure if there were some latches/clips holding the grooves in place. I will be keeping this item, but will definitely be adding some latches to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio M

customer_reviews.title: Great Vertical Hanging Solution for Small Spaces!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 5 x 10 laundry room, so not much space to hang anything. This fits perfectly in front of our dryer with enough room to have the door open. It has come in SO handy! It's easy to expand and collapse, and it stores almost anywhere, even behind our laundry room door. We use it for cloth diapers and sometimes I'll lay a shirt over the top to air dry. It's not big - you won't get multiple large items on it. But it's perfect for small things.
customer_reviews.author: Jbugadoodle07

customer_reviews.title: Useful for drying laundry on rainy days.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the first rack for a year. I use it in the winter to dry clothes in front of the woodstove, in the summer it accumulates dish towels. Just ordered a second one so I can fit more stuff. No problems with it falling apart. I have to be a little careful when moving it around: the top latches to one side to keep the rack unfolded and it doesn't lock in place so I just grab the sides and not the top to move it. Lots of bars to drape things on, which is great for small items, but really only fits a few pants and long sweaters.
customer_reviews.author: Dorena Rode

customer_reviews.title: RUN AWAY
customer_reviews.text: $10 to return is ridiculous for this cheaply made item. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Scott and Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Cheapily Made
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace a foldable drying rack my old roommate use to have without breaking the bank. I thought this was the same one she used, but this is much flimsier and doesn't stand in place firmly. The hooks that set it up come undone very easily. Needless to say it still does the trick so I'm keeping it, but not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: SO much better than I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves these racks and we have been using them for years. She typically gets the cheap, flimsy wood versions that feel like they're going to tip over. After the 2nd or 3rd one broke, I had enough. While looking, I saw this metal option and decided to give it a go. It's super sturdy, the white finish is nice, it looks well built, and it folds up as easily as any wooden rack. I see no negatives. The locking mechanism is strong. I recommend it fully.
customer_reviews.author: Reviews All Day Long

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Surprised by the quality. Seems sturdy. My last one was wooden and the rods continuously fell out, won’t be a problem With this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Life savers!
customer_reviews.text: I live in an apartment and am using one of the tiny washers out now, as there was no room for WD hookup. These racks are awesome! You can put many articles of clothing on them, take advantage of the V shape where they fold for socks etc, the corner points for hanging tank tops..easy to get creative with these racks. I bought two and was thinking maybe I should get a couple more, but changed my mind as these really do hold a lot of clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Rooby

customer_reviews.title: good for use
customer_reviews.text: The rack is smaller than I thought it would be, but works for what it's intended. It's lightweight and not as sturdy as I imagined, but it is easy to fold and put away. We just end up using it indoors moreso for damp clothes, not wet ones. it fits 3 jeans alone. Or 2-3 towels alone. Or good for plenty of underwear to dry. For adults, I would say get a bigger one. But this may be a good one moreso for kids clothes
customer_reviews.author: Teresa N

customer_reviews.title: I love this drying rack a lot
customer_reviews.text: I love this drying rack a lot! It folds up nicely and I can fit it in between the washer and the wall in my laundry room-just tucks away! When in use, it has many options for hanging many types and size garments. The only thing I don't love about it is when you unfold and snap it together to use, the rough metal hooks are wearing away the paint on side it snaps onto. Therefore, it's getting torn up and not looking as nice anymore. There should be a plastic piece it snaps onto instead of bare painted metal or something. Either way, it works!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Have 2
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and love them I don’t dry my clothes in the dryer, I throw shirts, pants, shorts on these and they dry pretty quickly. I feel if the top part is dry then I flip them over so the other side drys. I’d say every 30 mins I flip them
customer_reviews.author: Brian R. O.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Yes, my review is based on the value and quality versus the cheap price. No, I would not put a very heavy wet blanket on it, but I have hung normal clothes off of every row at once several times after wringing them out, and have had no issues. What a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Durable, sturdy and already assembled.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was hoping for, arrived fast and was super easy to set up as it's already put together so just pop up and snap at two places on top, so simple! I was worried it would be really flimsy but it seems pretty sturdy, I never really hang clothes to dry but we recently purchased a condo in Miami so I wanted something to put on the balcony to dry the towels after the beach to prevent that yucky moldy smell when they stay wet overnight if I'm not doing laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Danika Lee

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great drying rack. Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely great drying rack. I love the smooth surface and light weight, although it is sturdy enough to hold all my drying. It is easy to assemble, disassemble, carry, and slip into my closet when I am not using it. It fits in my apartment. It is wide enough for my slacks. It has a top "shelf" for my t-shirts. I haven't used a drying rack in ages, but the dryer in my apartment is shrinking my t-shirts. Also, I just bought some slacks that need to be line dried. I could not be happier with this drying rack.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Denizen

customer_reviews.title: Nice simple design, sturdy, holds a good amount of laundry.
customer_reviews.text: Love this drying rack. Nice simple design; easy for folding and unfolding. Very sturdy. Doesn't wobble. Holds a good amount of laundry. Wider and taller than my previous rack. I like having 3 bars across the top, either for hanging more long garments, side by side, or for stretching garments across for flatter drying. I like the white finish - smooth and clean. This is a very good choice of drying rack.
customer_reviews.author: Toria Burrell

customer_reviews.title: Great for light loads and small spaces
customer_reviews.text: I love this drying rack - it's exactly what I was looking for: It's lightweight, folds into a compact size and stores easily in a small space between the bathroom sink and the wall. It snaps together and apart easily, fits in the bathtub when opened, and the spacing of the bars allows for a good air flow and cuts drying time. Repeat - it's great for light loads. If you need a rack to dry heavy items (rugs) this isn't it, but for handwashables, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: R. Gaffney

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far!
customer_reviews.text: Yes!! So glad we bought this! We constantly hang clothes to dry (we pretty much only dry towels and pajamas in the dryer) and our old drying rack was broken and we had taped it together so we could still use it (LOL). Well, this was on sale the other day so I pulled the trigger and I'm so glad I did! This has MUCH more space than the old one, it's sturdy, and it folds away when not in use. It even has 1 extra bar than our old one did, and that one bar makes a difference. Very happy with the purchase and would highly recommend! Best $20 I've spent in some time!
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: holds a lot of clothes and folds up small
customer_reviews.text: After staying in Air B+B's in London, where it rains almost daily, and every Air B+B had a clothes washer but no dryer- I decided to get a rack and try drying clothes outside here in California. I discovered that it is actually very easy to directly hang clothes on hangers straight from the washer- and simply move them to the closet when dry. PGE rates in my area are at present .39 on peak (when i am home) My dryer draws 5 kw and would run for about 1 hour to dry all these clothes- so each time I use this handy little rack I am saving about $2.00 pre tax and my clothes are not wrinkled.....
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after  a year
customer_reviews.text: I liked this rack a lot. It was easy to fold and store, with lots of room to hang things, but it started falling apart after about a year. I fixed the piece that broke, but then another broke. I jury-rigged a solution, but then another part broke, and another. I am finally giving up. I am going to try to find something sturdier. Shouldn't a drying rack last for more that a year?
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Schiff

customer_reviews.title: Locks in Place
customer_reviews.text: Our wooden version of this finally fell apart and we had to find a new rack. Not as easy as you would think when you're used to something specific. I was happy to find this as it matched the shape of our old one, but was much more sturdy as it wasn't wooden. You just click the top in place and it's ready. No pushing snaps in place! I was also worried about rust due to the metal appearance, but it has a nice coating on it. I am not worried about it affecting my clothing at all. Great purchase, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Kdonaldson

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for drying bathing suits and delicate clothing, backpacks and big ridiculous blankets. I have a few wooden ones that always seem to break at the spot where the top comes down to lock onto the body of the rack, and was very pleased to find this metal version much sturdier. I LOVE these racks - saves a lot of life in clothing that the dryer would otherwise destroy, and honestly on nice hot windy days I just hang the laundry out in the back and save myself $$ on the gas bill.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Just okay. Good quality, poor design.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good quality and it does fold up pretty small. However the rods need to open further so there is more room to hang clothes on them. Clothes from the top bars cover the bottom bars and so on. It would be better if the bars were wider. Good otherwise. Plus the bottom 3 or 4 rungs are so low to the ground your clothes don't hang, they are virtually useless.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Quality could be better
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. The part that snaps into place on the top rail is difficult to align properly, and the first time I used it, it stripped the "paint" off the top rail. It also doesn't sit flat on the floor and rocks from side to side, which is okay for light items but may be a problem if heavier items are placed on it as it may tip over. I hope it lasts as long as the previous one I owned from another maker, but I'm not hopeful.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwisteph

customer_reviews.title: Compact when put away, lots of drying space when put up
customer_reviews.text: I'm really quite more impressed with this drying rack than I should be over a utility product When it's folded up, it's compact enough to fit behind a door without it preventing the door from being open. When it's in use, it's nice and tall - the other day I was able to hand 2 towels, 2 pairs of leggings, a dress, a shirt and two undergarments on it. It held a lot more than I expected. The top bar has a locking mechanism which keeps the stand in place - it's nice and tall, and even when open, it's got more length than width. It's very good for a compact place - highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ante Ems

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drying stand beacuse of all the reviews that it had. I dont think it deserve such a high raiting. My stand is not sturdy at all. It is moving and the material looks cheap. Anyway i guess you get what you pay. I still think that this drying stand is overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: MartinZ18

customer_reviews.title: Great for lingerie.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for my lingerie. As a retired female Marine we were trained that Time is of the Essence bc of our duties. We were taught to wash our bras, undies, hose etc while we showered. Well I continued to do the same and it's perfect. I don't have to launder my lingerie and it lasts longer bc they're hand washed! Taught my daughters to do the same! Try it! You'll never run out of clean lingerie!
customer_reviews.author: GySgt Maria USMC

customer_reviews.title: good clothesline alternative!!
customer_reviews.text: used outdoor clothesline for several years for items i didn't want to place in the dryer. all was well until some moron backed into the post and broke the clothesline. Didn't feel like putting it back up only for it to more than likely be destroyed again. i came on here and ordered this. I love it. i can put it up in a small area and my clothes are nice and dry within 24 hours. no more clothespins, or going out in the heat and humidity. construction seems strong for the price paid. I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: This thing fell apart
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought this, thinking it would last for at least a few years but within a couple of months it started falling apart. The folding mechanism broke and one by one various joints started falling apart and it started looking like a mechanical puzzle of sorts. I kept using it and basically stopped folding it but alas it finally gave in last week. I don't think this deserves even a single star for sturdiness. As wonderful as the product idea is, this particular version is a bad iteration on the execution: DO NOT BUY this if you want to use it for more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Rakesh

customer_reviews.title: Good, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy with this drying rack. It's good, seems durable, and gets the job done. My only issue is it is kind of a pain to unfold. I used to own a wooden one that unfolded with ease. This metal one does not just easily fold open--it's stiff and a bit of a nuisance at first to unfold. Otherwise, good product.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Wallin

customer_reviews.title: Used every week and still in great shape
customer_reviews.text: This is the second laundry rack I purchased of this style and so far it's pretty great. Easily folds and fits in a small nook between my dryer and wall and snaps in place when I need it to dry clothes every week. Stays out for about a day until everything's dry and has done its job every time with out falling over or coming apart. Has helped maintain the life of our garments and saved on electricity by allowing us to use our dryer less often. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased 3 of these over the last few years for different family members to hang dry clothing because it works so well. The first one we purchased recently fell apart after one of the screws came out and was lost. We were very impressed when the manufacturer immediately sent us a brand new rack, no questions asked. This rack works well for heavy items, sweaters, and everything else we've tried. It's easy to put up and down and stores flat. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Morbidelli

customer_reviews.title: Great drying rack for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rack for the price. It is easy to assemble, light, and sturdy. I can fit around 15 shirts on the rack, maybe less with a few sweaters. I'm drying my clothes less and less these days, so I might buy another rack so I can spread the shirts out better. One note, it has no rubber feet. A plastic cap covers the metal and is slanted. It doesn't make a difference to me, but flat rubber feet would be a slight improvement for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary G. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Great, lightweight, sturdy, and foldable
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I recently purchased a portable washer for our apartment. While we are deciding wether to buy a portable dryer as well, we decided to get this drying rack. It's really cool because while it is sturdy enough to hold our wet clothes it is light enough to be moved with the clothes still hanging. And it folds up nicely to save space in between uses. If you found my review helpful please hit the "helpful" button to let Amazon know.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Nicole

customer_reviews.title: This is a great rack.  Well built.  Worth the extra money compared to others.
customer_reviews.text: We shopped around. This is the best one we found. We used at home for a couple of weeks (even though we have an electric dryer) and now student is using in dorm room. Sturdy, held clothes on each "shelf" without falling down, etc. Well built. Good design to provide needed airflow so clothes will dry. We have lived in high humidity parts of the world; don't expect fast drying if you have high humidity in the room. Rack wires are well coated so coating should last and not give rust marks on your clothes.
customer_reviews.author: MikeF

customer_reviews.title: VERY STABLE
customer_reviews.text: The 1st one that was shipped to me was defective so Amazon immediately shipped another one. Great service!! After you set it up, you click the top/swinging pieces onto the top bar and it stabilizes the whole unit. I have other drying racks that are bigger and LOOK sturdier, but this one stays put when I am putting things on or moving things around. Because the other drying racks do not click onto the bar, the whole unit sometimes collapses when I move clothes around. This one stays put. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Already Rusting
customer_reviews.text: These look bright and lovely, but already, in 3 months, have started rusting and the one of the top center bars, keeps falling apart. I am going back and ordering from Target a Household Essentials Extendable Folding Drying Rack which is a bit more expensive but will last for 3 - 5 years. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: W. Frush

customer_reviews.title: Poles pop off
customer_reviews.text: Meets needs but flawed. Since the moment I took out of box the poles have a tendency of popping off their connectors and I have to put them back on while folding so there is enough clearance to get it back on. That being said they go back on and the rack is still functional. It has been working for three years with this constant fixing each time I try to open it to use. Tonight I finally thought I should write a review... I wish I had purchased a different one. I had a wooden one for over 10 years without this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica R.

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart after few uses
customer_reviews.text: Rack falls apart after a few months of use. The horizontal bars com off from the verticals (the screw pops off) in several places, and when you try to put one back in, another pops off.
customer_reviews.author: Sreenadh S. Jonnavithula

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I've had wooden clothes drying racks for years. Over time they've fallen apart, the rods become detached and the whole thing collapses. This brand is very good, very sturdy, strong. I hang all my delicates on it and they dry fast, no marks. And the rods seem very securely attached. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: homeschoolmomof2

customer_reviews.title: For all your athleisure attire!!👖👚👕🧢
customer_reviews.text: If you own sportswear, you know it's all delicate, cold wash & no dry madness. & if your ass does actually sweat in the gear, you also shouldn't let it rot & foul, for more than a few days, or week. Which means, you're ALWAYS washing & hanging dry. This is a Lifesaver. A Time saver. A Frustration reducer. Why'd I wait so long to buy?!?!?! It's nicely made. Lightweight. Easy to move & stash anywhere. Even loaded up. Holds a lot. I can fill it up nicely & still add hangers, hats, accessories on corners/sides. 💃!!️
customer_reviews.author: Bebe Blondell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my daughters cloth diapers. I will also use it for T-shirt or whatever it is I need to hang outside. Primarily used for her cloth diapers, so easy to move from indoors to outdoors and storing it is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very handy!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a studio apartment and air dry my clothes. This folding rack really helps and is very sturdy. I've had folding racks before and this is the sturdiest one I've ever had. I can pick it up, with clothes still hanging on it, and move it around the apartment without the whole thing collapsing/folding up. It's also easy to store in the closet or under my bed.
customer_reviews.author: Annie O.

customer_reviews.title: How can you possibly LOVE a drying rack
customer_reviews.text: How can you possibly LOVE a drying rack? Well, take it down and then you will see! It is in constant use as there are so many garments that I don't want to dry in the dryer -- This rack has surely repaid its initial investment in clothes that wear longer AND haven't shrunk two sizes -- It is a durable little thing, easily folded up and put away (mine NEVER is!) and holds a significant amount of clothing -- I would not recommend it for a FAMILY but for a party of 1 or 2, it's just PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: Meanne

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Much sturdier than one I purchased a few years back from a competitor. Folds up and stores easily. Exactly as advertised. If you're thinking of getting a cheaper variant take heed: I'd much rather spend a few more $$ and not have my clean, wet laundry fall all over our dog hair covered floor (yes, we do vacuum as is evidenced by my Dyson V7 review LOL) but you know how it is with pets.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah O.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, doesn’t harm clothes
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace one I had for years that someone stepped on while folded. It probably would have lasted forever otherwise. I feel this one will too. It’s very sturdy and I hang a lot of heavy items on it. My only gripe with this one is it’s a pain to get the top bar in place. Hence 4 stars. Maybe it will loosen up in time. Otherwise I’m very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne in GA

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done nicely
customer_reviews.text: I use this for the doggie towels that I use to wipe my two dogs wet feet every day after walks - from dew and from the creek. Also for dish cloths I use for cleaning. Until this contraption I had no place to hang them all. It’s not pretty, but it sure is practical! I simply fold it up small and put it away when company comes.
customer_reviews.author: GaMountainGirl

customer_reviews.title: VERY sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works. Had the old wooden one, gave out. What really makes the difference is that when opened up, the top bar really clicks tightly onto the other bar - so as not to collapse. Love these things for what can't go into dryer. Made of chrome, is heavier and sturdier than wood.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay open, collapses, pass this by.
customer_reviews.text: Everything works, except the bar that locks the unit in the open position does not engage, this the rack keeps collapsing. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Rods came loose in just a few months
customer_reviews.text: While it is lightweight and compatible three of the lower rods have come loos and are no longer usable. Because two are in one side and the other on the opposite side it is impossible to put all of them back in at the same time. Even then they don’t stay.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this drying rack 2 years ago and it's now finally starting to break down. Some of the bars occasionally pop out and have to be reinserted. That being said, it lasted longer than I expected for the price I paid. I could probably try to glue it somehow to keep it together but I think I've gotten my monies worth. For how often we use ours, it's time to upgrade to something larger and heavier duty, but this is a great drying rack for the price range!
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying my clothes rack. No more clothes drying everywhere! Great product. Fits nice in the place I wanted it in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper quality then expected.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a metal dryer like I had for years. This looks like metal but feels like hallow plastic. Much cheaper then expected and also much smaller then expected. The size is my fault for assuming and not looking at the measurements. The width of each rack would only be enough for one t-shirt or sweater to dry alone. You wouldn’t be able to put anything side by side other then very small clothes, like kids clothing or maybe tank tops. They don’t make them like they used to, that’s for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin D.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy.  Easily unfolded.  Nice looking.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had at least three wooden drying racks. One lasted 4 years. This last one only a year and a half before some of the the bars snapped off. I decided to go with metal this time. Shipped already assembled. Unfolded it easily. Great size. Top bar attaches easily to hold the unit together. I do predict this one will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Linda R.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I had an old wood one of these and the rods on the top kept popping out. This one is great! It is lightweight, easy to fold and unfold, and the rods won't pop out. I attached a picture to show how the top rods are attached. There is also something on the rods because my clothes aren't slipping off the rods.
customer_reviews.author: Willow

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and big enough
customer_reviews.text: I like wool blankets. Fortunately, in New Mexico, it's not a problem letting them air-dry (because they shrink if you put them in the dryer) outside even in winter. This rack is big enough to hold a full size blanket (have 2 drying racks by a different company; they're significantly smaller, so it's necessary to drape a blanket over both, which is awkward).
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Its super simple to put up and down, and it takes one click to get it in the position you want it in. It folds up small soyou can put it somewhere when you're not using it, but it's also small enough where you can leave it open between uses. I have an insane amount of laundry to do weekly between me and my two daughters and there is always somewhere on here to put our clothes!
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I gave this only four stars because of the size. Everything else about this product is amazing, its durability, it’s Strank’s, it’s actually a very good product. However I was somewhat disappointed they are a little bit smaller than the wooden ones that you can buy in local retailers. I hope that they make a bigger version soon. I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Chelpiper

customer_reviews.title: Very great
customer_reviews.text: This product is a great buy! I love how easy it is to put together and collapse. I can store it super easily in small areas and it's super light and sturdy at the same time. I try not to put heavy items on it, although, I don't think that it would be a problem if I did.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Racks like these are poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: Racks like these are poorly designed. This Amazon basic rack is fine compared to other similar racks. However, racks such as theare much better. The more costly X shaped racks are superior because they hold much more (more than twice as much in my case) , are less likely to tip over or collapse while using, and fold smaller for storage. I never use my Amazon Basics clothes drying rack. My Moerman rack (or any similar rack) is much more versatile. I think this Amazon Basic rack is fine if you do not have many clothes to dry. However, if you are going to be air drying a significant amount of clothing, then you would need more than one.
customer_reviews.author: humblesmurph

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cloth diapering!!
customer_reviews.text: It folds away for easy storage and it's really light weight. Once you clip the top shelf on itself, it's pretty sturdy too. It's taller than my toddler, which was really surprising. It's big enough between "shelfs" to hang an unbuttoned bum genius insert.
customer_reviews.author: Desoura

customer_reviews.title: Small outdoor drying of clothes for people living on small spaces.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because I set it on my patio and I use it to dry my clothes that I don’t put in the dryer, plus it is sturdy enough to hold up with most weights in clothing or even rugs. I like the fact that I can fold it up and put it out of sight whenever I am expecting guests to sit on my patio.
customer_reviews.author: Woodee

customer_reviews.title: Should’ve bought one years ago
customer_reviews.text: Visited my daughters in South Korea where they don’t use clothes dryers (!!!) - & returned feeling guilty about how much energy ours uses. Immediately bought one, very glad I did. I just toss the stuff in our (energystar!) dryer afterward to soften & dewrinkle for a couple minutes!
customer_reviews.author: RedNepenthe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific product. It is easy to use. I have had mine for a year...no chips, continues to serve me well. You do need a decent space for storage. Collapsed it requires 4-6 inches of closet space. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Pittsburgh Lady

customer_reviews.title: Falls Down Constantly
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst rack dryer ever! The bars to hold items have to be snuggly fit into not so snug slots on both ends of every bar. It does not fold down accordion style. Each bar falls out of its respective socket if you stand too close to it. Seriously. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: sgallion

customer_reviews.title: Great little workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: The dryer rack is just what I’ve been looking for. It’s easy to open & easy to fold back up again. The footprint is small but it holds a lot. Just like other reviewers have said, it fits perfectly inside the tub so if you’re clothes are still dripping it’s not a problem. All the parts were there including the little rubber feet to protect the surface that the rack is on. I definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: $Saver

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME !!
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for a laundry rack that was 1 solid piece and here you go. NOT a put together !! Easy to unfold and poof there you go ready to use !!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy L Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great width and locking frame
customer_reviews.text: I have several similar to this but was always having to use plastic hangers for a number of items as the racks were not wide enough. Finally decided to order a wider rack and this one is great. Best of all, it actually “clicks” into place when opened up (top rack fits tightly to opposite side) which is a great feature and one I did not even know I wanted! Now even when completely utilized, I can move the rack from one place to another. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: linda from Long Island

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and unstable
customer_reviews.text: Did not like quality of this item. Poorly made and very unstable. Liked the size and fold up. Returned as it was not useable for me. Surprised by all the great reviews. Not sure if product changed or I just got a cheap Chinese item. Two stars for Amazon taking it back.
customer_reviews.author: J R

customer_reviews.title: Great drying rack
customer_reviews.text: I love these foldable drying racks! This is my second purchase, as I needed additional drying space. I prefer to hang dry most of my clothing because it keeps my clothes looking newer longer. It’s easy to fold if you need to tuck it away but I leave mine up.
customer_reviews.author: Bena

customer_reviews.title: IT BROKE
customer_reviews.text: I CAN'T USE IT ANYMORE IT IS BROKEN GREAT DON'T USE IT. THE TUBE CAME AWAY HAD A SCREW TO MAKE THE ITEM LARGER SO THIS WOULD NOT HAPPEN.....THEY KNEW IT WAS NOT GOOD
customer_reviews.author: sallyanne haydon

customer_reviews.title: Total disappointment-no screws so I’m not able to even set it up yet.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t been able to set this up yet, because it didn’t come with screws. So now I’ve got to take the time to figure out what size screws and then find them. I’ve been shopping online because of Covid so buying one more item when it should have been included is irritating. Total disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Wirth

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy piece
customer_reviews.text: Can’t believe I never had one of these things! All my AirBB in Europe had one and I loved it! I ordered one before I left Spain and it was at my doorstep when I got home! Folds up nicely when not in use, came in a simple box all ready to open and so freakin laundry! Love love... no more laundry slung over chairs and hooks around house.
customer_reviews.author: Petunia

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: One of the metal cross bars broke. Not happy with purchase. Cheaply made. Also is a lot smaller than I thought.
customer_reviews.author: A Shopper

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Foldable Clothes Drying Laundry Rack - Chrome
feature_bullets: Clothes drying rack for energy savings and gentle drying so your clothes last longer
Made of durable yet lightweight steel that is easy to move from room to room
Accordion design folds flat for compact storage
Chrome surface protects against rust and mildew

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars14,978 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
